page.title: 06FEATURES PAST & PRESENT
page.content: {PRINCIPAL FEATURES PAST & PRESENT { }PUBLIC HOUSES Nowadays there are two public houses in the village _ the Crown and the Red Lion,one Social Club(The British Legion), a Sports Centre and a Guest House. At one time there were nine other pubs. The Banks of Clay closed at least 100 years ago,The Crooked Chimney closed in the 1940s,The Victory/Lord Nelson was built at the time of the Battle of Trafalgar. The Bridge Inn which is still standing and used as a private residence,The Rose and Crown closed in the 1950s,The Rising Sun was demolished in the 1970s,The Norfolk Hero closed before 1900,and The Swan closed in 1984.
